title: Aside from Henry VIII serving dolphins as a dish at his banquets, are we referring to the fish or the mammal? - Quora

response.answer_text: Views upon what was considered fish wasn’t always the same in history as to what we consider fish today. It wasn’t just aquatic mammals who resemble fish(such as dolphins) that got eaten and considered as fish-but also, for example, an otter. Though I am not sure if it was still the case at a lifetime of Henry VIII, aquatic mammals were eaten at his court and porpoise were favourite of his first wife.
